verses.text: Again, David gathered together all \add the\add* chosen \add men\add* of Israel , thirty thousand.

And David arose , and went with all the people that \add were\add* with him from Baale of Judah , to bring up from thence the ark of God , whose name is called by the name of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of hosts that dwelleth \add between\add* the cherubims.\f + \fr 6.2 \ft Baale: or, Baalah, that is, Kirjath-jearim\f*\f + \fr 6.2 \ft whose name…: or, at which the name, even the name of the \+nd LORD\+nd* of hosts, was called upon\f*

And they set the ark of God upon a new cart , and brought it out of the house of Abinadab that \add was\add* in Gibeah : and Uzzah and Ahio , the sons of Abinadab , drave the new cart.\f + \fr 6.3 \ft set: Heb. made to ride\f*\f + \fr 6.3 \ft Gibeah: or, the hill\f*
And they brought it out of the house of Abinadab which \add was\add* at Gibeah , accompanying the ark of God : and Ahio went before the ark.\f + \fr 6.4 \ft accompanying: Heb. with\f*

And David and all the house of Israel played before the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* on all manner of \add instruments made of\add* fir wood , even on harps , and on psalteries , and on timbrels , and on cornets , and on cymbals. \p

¶ And when they came to Nachon’s threshingfloor , Uzzah put forth \add his hand\add* to the ark of God , and took hold of it; for the oxen shook \add it\add*.\f + \fr 6.6 \ft Nachon: also called Chidon\f*\f + \fr 6.6 \ft shook it: or, stumbled\f*

And the anger of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* was kindled against Uzzah ; and God smote him there for \add his\add* error ; and there he died by the ark of God.\f + \fr 6.7 \ft error: or, rashness\f*

And David was displeased , because the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* had made a breach upon Uzzah : and he called the name of the place Perez-uzzah to this day.\f + \fr 6.8 \ft made: Heb. broken\f*\f + \fr 6.8 \ft Perez-uzzah: that is, the breach of Uzzah\f*

And David was afraid of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* that day , and said , How shall the ark of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* come to me?
So David would not remove the ark of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* unto him into the city of David : but David carried it aside into the house of Obed-edom the Gittite.

And the ark of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* continued in the house of Obed-edom the Gittite three months : and the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* blessed Obed-edom , and all his household. \p

¶ And it was told king David , saying , The \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath blessed the house of Obed-edom , and all that \add pertaineth\add* unto him, because of the ark of God. So David went and brought up the ark of God from the house of Obed-edom into the city of David with gladness.
And it was \add so\add*, that when they that bare the ark of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* had gone six paces , he sacrificed oxen and fatlings.
And David danced before the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* with all \add his\add* might ; and David \add was\add* girded with a linen ephod.
So David and all the house of Israel brought up the ark of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* with shouting , and with the sound of the trumpet.

And as the ark of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* came into the city of David , Michal Saul’s daughter looked through a window , and saw king David leaping and dancing before the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*; and she despised him in her heart. \p

¶ And they brought in the ark of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and set it in his place , in the midst of the tabernacle that David had pitched for it: and David offered burnt offerings and peace offerings before the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*.  +  r 6.17  t pitched: Heb. stretched *
And as soon as David had made an end of offering burnt offerings and peace offerings , he blessed the people in the name of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of hosts.

And he dealt among all the people , \add even\add* among the whole multitude of Israel , as well to the women as men , to every one a cake of bread , and a good piece \add of flesh\add*, and a flagon \add of wine\add*. So all the people departed every one to his house. \p

¶ Then David returned to bless his household. And Michal the daughter of Saul came out to meet David , and said , How glorious was the king of Israel to day , who uncovered himself to day in the eyes of the handmaids of his servants , as one of the vain fellows shamelessly uncovereth himself!\f + \fr 6.20 \ft shamelessly: or, openly\f*

And David said unto Michal , \add It was\add* before the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, which chose me before thy father , and before all his house , to appoint me ruler over the people of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, over Israel : therefore will I play before the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*.

And I will yet be more vile than thus , and will be base in mine own sight : and of the maidservants which thou hast spoken of, of them shall I be had in honour.\f + \fr 6.22 \ft of the…: or, of the handmaids of my servants\f*
Therefore Michal the daughter of Saul had no child unto the day of her death.
